23	SPARQL_GENERATION_TEMPLATE = """
24	Task: Generate a SPARQL SELECT statement for querying a graph database.
25	For instance, to find all email addresses of John Doe, the following 
26	query in backticks would be suitable:
27	```
28	PREFIX foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>
29	SELECT ?email
30	WHERE {{
31	    ?person foaf:name "John Doe" .
32	    ?person foaf:mbox ?email .
33	}}
34	```
35	Instructions:
36	Use only the node types and properties provided in the schema.
37	Do not use any node types and properties that are not explicitly provided.
38	Include all necessary prefixes.
39	
40	Examples:
41	
42	Schema:
43	{schema}
44	Note: Be as concise as possible.
45	Do not include any explanations or apologies in your responses.
46	Do not respond to any questions that ask for anything else than 
47	for you to construct a SPARQL query.
48	Do not include any text except the SPARQL query generated.
49	
50	The question is:
51	{prompt}"""

143	    ?person foaf:mbox ?email .
144	}}
145	```
146	Instructions:
147	Use only the node types and properties provided in the schema.
148	Do not use any node types and properties that are not explicitly provided.
149	Include all necessary prefixes.
150	Schema:
151	{schema}

153	Do not include any explanations or apologies in your responses.
154	Do not respond to any questions that ask for anything else than for you to construct a SPARQL query.
155	Do not include any text except the SPARQL query generated.
156	
157	The question is:
158	{prompt}"""

166	PREFIX foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>

11	
12	Sensitive personal information in the question is masked for privacy.
13	For instance, if the original text says "Giana is good," it will be changed
14	to "PERSON_998 is good."
15	
16	Here's how to handle these changes:
17	* Consider these masked phrases just as placeholders, but still refer to
18	them in a relevant way when answering.
19	* It's possible that different masked terms might mean the same thing.
20	Stick with the given term and don't modify it.
21	* All masked terms follow the "TYPE_ID" pattern.
22	* Please don't invent new masked terms. For instance, if you see "PERSON_998,"
23	don't come up with "PERSON_997" or "PERSON_999" unless they're already in the question.

90	NEWS_RESPONSE_PARSED = [
91	    Document(page_content=str(result["description"]), metadata=result)
92	    for result in NEWS_RESPONSE_RAW["news"]["results"]
93	]
94	
95	
96	@responses.activate
97	def test_raw_results() -> None:
98	    responses.add(
99	        responses.GET, f"{TEST_ENDPOINT}/search", json=MOCK_RESPONSE_RAW, status=200
100	    )
